name: CoRoT-7
scenarioDescription:
The CoRoT-7 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoT-7 is a star with 0.82 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.83 times its radius. It is located 523.94 light years away from the solar system.

CoRoT-7 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoT-7 system


CoRoT-7 c

CoRoT-7 c was discovered by the CoRoT observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of CoRoT-7 c is 8.40474 times the mass of Earth. At 8.40474 Earth masses, CoRoT-7 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoT-7, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by CoRoT.
